goal.tools.mc.explorer.tauriainen

Class Product

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.mc.explorer.tauriainen.Product
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Automaton

    public class Product
extends java.lang.Object
implements Automaton
    Represents the product automaton used with Tauriainen's NDFS algorithm. It may be possible to reuse this automaton for more other NDFS algorithms as well, and maybe also for strongly connected component algorithms.
    Author:
    sungshik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Product(Program prog, Property prop, int sizeCurlyF)
      Constructs a product automaton according to the specified parameters.

      Methods

      void generate()
      Generates the entire state space of the automaton.

      Gets the initial state of the automaton.
      int getSize()
      Gets the number of states for which successors have been defined (this is not necessarily equal to the number of states that have already been identified).
      ProductState[] getSuccessors(State _q)
      Gets the successors of q.
      boolean hasSuccessorsYet(ProductState q)
      Determines whether successors have already been defined for the specified state.
      ProductState[] setNoSuccessors(ProductState q)
      Sets the set of successors of the specified state to empty.

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public void generate()
        Description copied from interface: Automaton
        Generates the entire state space of the automaton. Although implementations of this interface may decide how the automaton is represented and stored internally, it is assumed that some internal storage facility is present (otherwise, this method would not make much sense).
        Specified by:
        generate in interface Automaton

      • hasSuccessorsYet

        public boolean hasSuccessorsYet(ProductState q)
        Determines whether successors have already been defined for the specified state.
        Parameters:
        q - - The state to check successor definition for.
        Returns:
        true if successors have been defined; false otherwise.

      • setNoSuccessors

        Returns:
